Questions.Question: Who said 'Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is from Martin Luther King Jr.'s 'Letter from Birmingham Jail' in 1963.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The only way to deal with this life is to accept it'?
Questions.Explanation: Malcolm X, a prominent civil rights activist, spoke these words during a speech in 1964.

Questions.Question: Who said 'You must be the change you wish to see in the world'?
Questions.Explanation: This famous quote is attributed to Mahatma Gandhi, the leader of India's nonviolent independence movement.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The future belongs to those who prepare for it today'?
Questions.Explanation: Malcolm X emphasized the importance of preparation for a better future in his speeches.

Questions.Question: Who said 'In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends'?
Questions.Explanation: Martin Luther King Jr. spoke about the significance of friends' silence during the civil rights movement.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall'?
Questions.Explanation: Nelson Mandela, the South African anti-apartheid revolutionary, shared this inspiring perspective.

Questions.Question: Who said 'If you want to make peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies'?
Questions.Explanation: Moshe Dayan, an Israeli military leader and politician, expressed the importance of dialogue with adversaries.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear'?
Questions.Explanation: Aung San Suu Kyi, a Burmese politician and Nobel Peace Prize laureate, conveyed this powerful message.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The revolution is not an apple that falls when it is ripe. You have to make it fall'?
Questions.Explanation: Che Guevara, an Argentine Marxist revolutionary, emphasized the need for active participation in revolution.

Questions.Question: Who said 'I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear'?
Questions.Explanation: Rosa Parks, a civil rights activist, highlighted the power of determination in overcoming fear.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The power of imagination makes us infinite'?
Questions.Explanation: John Lennon, a musician and peace activist, recognized the boundless potential of human imagination.
